channel.title: Need some tips

item.title: Need some tips
item.dc:creator: @solemn_wishes solemn wishes
item.description:
@solemn_wishes wrote:

u[quote=“Freddy1990, post:2, topic:77484”]Try basing your walking on visual markers on the minimap, for example rocks, and such, you could also try SRL’s radial walking features…
Though in this particular case, just try to click the bank symbol to go to the bank and the tree to go back :)[/quote]

Listen to the wise freddy good sir, blakeman i am sorry to say that even with your current code if it did somehow work the chances of you getting banned are allmost certain. I would surgest yes using visual map properties for guidence but also writing, or using a better mouse function.

If you need anymore help please feel free to ask me.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some tips
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Try basing your walking on visual markers on the minimap, for example rocks, and such, you could also try SRL’s radial walking features…
Though in this particular case, just try to click the bank symbol to go to the bank and the tree to go back

Read full topic

item.title: Need some tips
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Hey. I need some tips. I’m trying to make a script for a draynor woodcutter, but the problem is, the map and the screen and all that shit doesnt line up, and its incredibly hard to get my guy to the place i want him. Heres my script so far:

program DraynorWoodCutter; {.include SRL/SRL.scar} //--------------------------------------------Variables var count: Integer; //--------------------------------------------Tracking Procedure track; begin if(count = 1)then writeln('Banked 1 time'); end; //--------------------------------------------Main Process procedure process; begin Wait(2000+random(500)); ClickMouse(652, 184, true); Wait(2000+random(500)); MoveMouseSmooth(41, 266); Wait(500+random(50)); ClickMouse(41, 266, true); Wait(9000+random(500)); ClickMouse(256, 296, true); Wait(4000+random(500)); ClickMouse(251, 288, true); Wait(3000+random(500)); if (FindColorTolerance(x, y , 3432536, 175, 88, 242, 130, 150)) then MoveMouseSmooth(200, 120); Wait(500+random(100)); ClickMouse(200, 120, false); Wait(500+random(100)); ClickMouse(177, 195, true); if (FindColorTolerance(x, y, 16776960, 248, 183, 291, 136, 150)) then ClickMouse(220, 182, true); end; //--------------------------------------------Clear Shortcut procedure c; begin ClearDebug end; //--------------------------------------------Activate client procedure clientfind; begin ActivateClient; c; Writeln ('Client Identified'); end; //--------------------------------------------Initiate begin clientfind; process; end.

Read full topic
